info.title: Relay API
info.description: Use these API to manage Azure Relay resources through Azure Resource Manager.

get.description: Lists all available Relay REST API operations.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Check the specified namespace name availability.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters to check availability of the specified namespace name.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all the available namespaces within the subscription regardless of the resourceGroups.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all the available namespaces within the ResourceGroup.

200.description: Namespaces by resource group returned successfully

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create a namespace resource.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes an existing namespace. This operation also removes all associated resources under the namespace.

202.description: Namespace delete request has been accepted for processing and the operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Namespace delete request has been accepted, but the namespace was not found.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Returns the description for the specified namespace.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Creates or updates a namespace. Once created, this namespace's resource manifest is immutable. This operation is idempotent.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for updating a namespace resource.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.
Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates an authorization rule for a namespace.

200.description: Request to create namespace authorization rule succeeded.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: Request to delete namespace authorization rule succeeded.

204.description: No content. The request has been accepted but the namespace authorization rule was not found.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Authorization rule for a namespace by name.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Primary and secondary connection strings to the namespace.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Regenerates the primary or secondary connection strings to the namespace.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to regenerate authorization rule.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists the hybrid connection within the namespace.

200.description: Request to retrieve hybrid connections by namespace succeeded.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a service hybrid connection. This operation is idempotent.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create a hybrid connection.

200.description: Request to create hybrid connections succeeded.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: Request to delete hybrid connection succeeded.

204.description: No content. The request has been accepted but the hybrid connection was not found.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Returns the description for the specified hybrid connection.

200.description: Successfully retrieved description for the hybrid connection.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Authorization rules for a hybrid connection.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates an authorization rule for a hybrid connection.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes a hybrid connection authorization rule.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Hybrid connection authorization rule for a hybrid connection by name.

200.description: Hybrid connection authorization rule returned successfully.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Primary and secondary connection strings to the hybrid connection.

200.description: Request to retirve connection strings to the hybrid connection succeeded.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Regenerates the primary or secondary connection strings to the hybrid connection.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to regenerate authorization rule.

200.description: Request to regenerate connection strings to hybrid connection succeeded.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists the WCF relays within the namespace.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a WCF relay. This operation is idempotent.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create a WCF relay.

200.description: Request to create WCF relay succeeded.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.
Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Returns the description for the specified WCF relay.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Authorization rules for a WCF relay.

put.description: Creates or updates an authorization rule for a WCF relay.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes a WCF relay authorization rule.

200.description: Request to delete WCF relay authorization rule succeeded.

204.description: Request accepted butthe authorization rule does not exist.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get authorizationRule for a WCF relay by name.

200.description: Request for WCF relay authorization rule succeeded.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Primary and secondary connection strings to the WCF relay.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Regenerates the primary or secondary connection strings to the WCF relay.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to regenerate authorization rule.

default.description: Relay error response describing why the operation failed.

value.description: Result of the list hybrid connections.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results. Not empty if value contains incomplete list hybrid connection operation.

HybridConnectionListResult.description: The response of the list hybrid connection operation.

createdAt.description: The time the hybrid connection was created.

updatedAt.description: The time the namespace was updated.

listenerCount.description: The number of listeners for this hybrid connection. Note that min : 1 and max:25 are supported.

requiresClientAuthorization.description: Returns true if client authorization is needed for this hybrid connection; otherwise, false.

userMetadata.description: The usermetadata is a placeholder to store user-defined string data for the hybrid connection endpoint. For example, it can be used to store descriptive data, such as a list of teams and their contact information. Also, user-defined configuration settings can be stored.

value.description: Result of the list WCF relay operation.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results. Not empty if value contains incomplete list of WCF relays.

WcfRelaysListResult.description: The response of the list WCF relay operation.

isDynamic.description: Returns true if the relay is dynamic; otherwise, false.

createdAt.description: The time the WCF relay was created.

updatedAt.description: The time the namespace was updated.

listenerCount.description: The number of listeners for this relay. Note that min :1 and max:25 are supported.

requiresClientAuthorization.description: Returns true if client authorization is needed for this relay; otherwise, false.

requiresTransportSecurity.description: Returns true if transport security is needed for this relay; otherwise, false.

userMetadata.description: The usermetadata is a placeholder to store user-defined string data for the WCF Relay endpoint. For example, it can be used to store descriptive data, such as list of teams and their contact information. Also, user-defined configuration settings can be stored.

WcfRelay.description: Description of the WCF relay resource.

value.description: Result of the list namespace operation.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results. Not empty if value contains incomplete list of namespaces.

RelayNamespaceListResult.description: The response from the list namespace operation.

createdAt.description: The time the namespace was created.

updatedAt.description: The time the namespace was updated.

serviceBusEndpoint.description: Endpoint you can use to perform Service Bus operations.

value.description: Result of the list authorization rules operation.

nextLink.description: Link to the next set of results. Not empty if value contains incomplete list of authorization rules.

AuthorizationRuleListResult.description: The response from the list namespace operation.

rights.description: The rights associated with the rule.

AuthorizationRule.description: Description of a namespace authorization rule.

primaryConnectionString.description: Primary connection string of the created namespace authorization rule.

secondaryConnectionString.description: Secondary connection string of the created namespace authorization rule.

primaryKey.description: A base64-encoded 256-bit primary key for signing and validating the SAS token.

secondaryKey.description: A base64-encoded 256-bit secondary key for signing and validating the SAS token.

keyName.description: A string that describes the authorization rule.

key.description: Optional. If the key value is provided, this is set to key type, or autogenerated key value set for key type.

RegenerateAccessKeyParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the regenerate authorization rule operation, specifies which key neeeds to be reset.

UnavailableReason.description: Specifies the reason for the unavailability of the service.

name.description: The namespace name to check for availability. The namespace name can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens. The namespace must start with a letter, and it must end with a letter or number.

CheckNameAvailability.description: Description of the check name availability request properties.

message.description: The detailed info regarding the reason associated with the namespace.

nameAvailable.description: Value indicating namespace is available. Returns true if the namespace is available; otherwise, false.

reason.description: The reason for unavailability of a namespace.

CheckNameAvailabilityResult.description: Description of the check name availability request properties.

OperationListResult.description: Result of the request to list Relay operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of Relay operations supported by resource provider.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: Invoice, etc.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

ErrorResponse.description: Error reponse indicates Relay service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

resourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupNameParameter.description: Name of the Resource group within the Azure subscription.
